alert.note: Alert for Southern Meade Co Plains (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 1:29PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Meade County through 200 PM MDT... At 129 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Bear Butte State Park, or 14 miles northeast of Sturgis, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Meade County, northeast of Sturgis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm is producing large quantities of hail. Driving through deep hail is like driving on slushy roads. Slow down and do not brake suddenly. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for west central South Dakota.
